department: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
full_summary:
### Request for Standing Offer (RFSO)

#### RFSO Title
Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) Seeks Standing Offer for Office Furniture and Workplace Modernization Services

#### RFSO Reference Number
WS3645938346

#### RFSO Modification Summary
 Revision 006 has been issued to update the [Annex A-1 and Questions and Answers] document.

#### RFSO Notice Information
Publication Date: November 3, 2022
Tender Closing Date: March 31, 2023, at 14:00 (local time)

#### RFSO Description
Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) intends to establish a Standing Offer for the supply, delivery, installation, and optional services for Workspaces Furniture as part of PSPC - Real Property Services Workplace Modernization projects under the "Call-Up Procedures" ( Annex G). This Standing Offer will be used to meet the needs of the Department of Public Works and Government Services on an "as and when requested" basis.

#### Documents and Conditions of Participation
The full Request for Standing Offer and attachments are accessible and downloadable only after logging into the SAP Ariba account. Technical support for SAP Ariba can be sought through the CanadaBuys Service Desk agents: [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/contact-support](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/contact-support).

#### Trade Agreements
The Standing Offer is open to firms that are able to satisfy the requirements under the following trade agreements: [enumerated list of trade agreements]

#### Procurement Category
Goods and Services (GD)
Procurement Method
Competitive - Open Tendering
Notice Type
Request for Standing Offer (RFSO)

#### Series of Annexes and Attachments
A complete set of documents is available upon login with SAP Ariba. Procurement Catalyst is not required to access the RFSO document.

#### Competition Documents
These documents can be accessed  by creating an account with SAP Ariba. Copies may be requested from the PWGSC contracting officer at [james.macisaac@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:james.macisaac@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca).

Original document went from circa 1,780 words to 400 words. I kept almost all of the relevant data and information, but changed the structure to make it easier to read. In the final output, I have kept important information which makes it still considerable for a technical writing
